byline.contributor: Farah Samti contributed reporting from Tunis

abstract: Tunisian government says suicide bomber set off explosion that killed 12 members of presidential guard in Tunis; Islamic State has claimed responsibility for attack; officials move to increase security around country.
lead_paragraph: Tunisian authorities, who have declared a state of emergency, also temporarily closed the border with Libya after an attack in the capital on Tuesday.

headline.main: Tunisia Says Attack in Capital Was Suicide Bombing
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Africa; Tunisia: Attack Was a Suicide Bombing, Officials Say

snippet: Tunisian authorities, who have declared a state of emergency, also temporarily closed the border with Libya after an attack in the capital on Tuesday.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
